text:
Hi guys! Great community.

 I'm new to HubSpot API so the question might seem a bit basic : I'd like to create a webhook that would send some line items properties after a deal is won.
1. in the worflows, should I use "send a webhook" or "custom code"?
2. I would need the SKU (ID), quantity, discount, unit price, frequency of all line items + the deal ID and company ID associated + total discount and VAT of the quote 
The end goal is to retrieve the information in Make to send it to another system

Thanks in advanced, I'm a bit stuck now !

Hi <@U05C291ATTR>
If you have api in send a webhook or else use the custom code for other system.
Hi <@U05E8CWD5DE>! Thank you for responsing. Not sure why I retrieved an error when I updated it to 1000, Iâ€™ll try it again.
Thanks, but how do I send that information then with custom code?
<@U05C291ATTR> We will need api to send information to that another system.

Hi, Best CRM community,
I was trying to <https://api.hubapi.com/webhooks/v3/{appId}/subscriptions|get all webhook subscription> using OAuth authentication and I was getting this below error but It is working fine with *Developer* *API Key.*

I also checked /crm/v3/objects/contacts endpoint with Access-Token, working fine. Not sure why i'm getting error with webhook apis.

```"{\"status\":\"error\",\"message\":\"The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.\",\"correlationId\":\"uuid\",\"links\":{\"support\":\"<https://help.HubSpot.com/>\",\"forum\":\"<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations>\"},\"category\":\"MISSING_SCOPES\"}"```
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>

Please help me to get it to work.

Hi guys, I hope you're doing well. I would greatly appreciate your assistance with the following:

How can I send user login data from my webpage so that, after clicking the help button, the bot doesn't ask for information like name and email, but rather automatically sends it to HubSpot when initiating the conversation?

Additionally, if the contact doesn't exist in HubSpot, I would like it to be created first and then initiate the chat with the preloaded data for the support team.

PS: I already have the developer token, and my backend is in Python.

I would also appreciate your help in customizing the help button. How can I change its size or even place text within the button?

I would be extremely grateful for your assistance with these matters. :heart::clap:
Yes just select the elements you want to listen to in js and add a function to it

Hello all! I am new here and a very new HubSpot developer. I have a project that I am currently working on - creating a serverless function to query a custom object that I built. After a few hours of Google, documentation, and trying my luck at what ChatGPT+ had to say... I think I am stuck. Since I am building this as a serverless function and trying to query a custom object, I found that I need to setup local development and install axios (right?). Does anyone have any good documentation or a repo of doing something like this? Here is the code that I am trying to run, but I am getting a "request failed with status code 403" (I am testing the response via PostMan so I am not sure if this has naything ot do with it):

`const axios = require('axios');`

exports.main = async (_, sendResponse) => {
    const apiKey = 'MY_API_KEY; // Replace with your actual HubSpot API Key
    const objectTypeId = 'MY_OBJ'; _`// Replace with your actual Object Type ID`_

    `_try_ {`
        const response = `_await_ axios.get(`<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/${objectTypeId}>`, {`
            params: {
                limit: 10, _`// You can adjust the limit as per your needs`_
                `archived: false`
            `},`
            `headers: {`
                `'Content-Type': 'application/json',`
                `'Authorization': `Bearer ${apiKey}``
            `}`
        `});`

        `console.log(response.data);`
        _`// sendResponse is a callback function you call to send your response.`_
        `sendResponse({body: response.data, statusCode: 200});`
    `} _catch_ (error) {`
        console.error('Fetch failed', error.message);
        sendResponse({body: error.message, statusCode: 500});
    }
};

Any help would be awesome!

Hi all.
I have a developer account
I created application
Verified URL for my APP

Added Event subscriptions to webhook
in Event subscriptions, details I tested sending data to URL - OK.
But if I change live data in HubSpot, webhooks are not sent info to URL

What do I have set up incorrectly?

Okay, I was able to get a response back - my code "worked" fine. However, now I cannot see all the properties from the object, I only see some system created ones:
"properties": {
                "hs_createdate": "2023-06-26T14:35:57.325Z",
                "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2023-06-26T14:37:48.174Z",
                "hs_object_id": "7120709911"

<@U05DY31E2J1> you can have it return desired properties with a `properties` url parameter set to a comma separated desired properties string `custom_property_1,custom_property_2,createdate,amount,whatever`

<@U038DUUV3GE> Thank you for the response!

So, my params would look something like this?
params: {
                limit: 10, _// You can adjust the limit as per your needs_
                archived: false,
                properties: {
                    name, address, state
                }
I would think it would be `properties: 'name,address,state'`
Thanks, I will give this a try!
Yeah, I think you are right - I was looking at the headers section!
<@U038DUUV3GE> That was it! Thank you so much.

For future references if you end up using the search api, that properties param will instead be on the request body and as an array of strings `properties: ['name', 'address', 'state']` rather than a comma separated string of property names

<@U038DUUV3GE> For sure, that is what i will be working on tomorrow. I need to some how call this serverless function after a user inputs a zip code... So that should be interesting.

Would I just drop this URL into a custom module and then display that on a page? I am, at best, a very basic CMS developer whenever it comes to HubSpot.
I havenâ€™t really done anything with HubSpot CMS so Iâ€™m not sure, I mostly build integrations between HubSpot and other 3rd party services via the HubSpot API
This message was deleted.
